thread.title: Brandon High principal nominated to state Board of Education
thread.title_full: Brandon High principal nominated to state Board of Education - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Brandon High principal nominated to state Board of Education
text:
JACKSON, Miss. (AP) - Mississippi Gov. Phil Bryant has nominated Brandon High School principal Buddy Bailey to the state Board of Education.
Bailey will serve several months while awaiting confirmation by state senators in 2016. That's common practice for people nominated to state boards while the Legislature is not in session.
Bryant chose Bailey on Friday to serve the final eight years of a nine-year term started by Richard Morrison, who is leaving the state board and stepping down from the job as an assistant superintendent of Rankin County schools. A new superintendent has been elected in Rankin County.
Morrison's seat on the nine-member board must be filled by a school administrator.
Bailey has been Brandon High principal since 2008. Before that, he was principal of Brandon Middle School, starting in 2000.
